column4: whenever I try to move my cursor over any kind of music file, nautilus goes grey and becomes unresponsive. Are there any logs or anything I can check?
just ask your question once, someone will help you if they can
ok
search the internet, run nautilus in some sort of debug mode with terminal output, or try removing the packages that might be involved in the process.
iirc, there are special packages that enable that functionality in nautilus
I have searched the net, posted on 5 different forums. I am not aware of how to run nautilus in debug mode. Could you please tell me how?
lol, i dont know either :P
is there any bug about it?
lol ok. iirc? acronymfinder has so many definitions :P
there are some which may be the same
https://bugs.launchpad.net/ubuntu/+source/nautilus/+bug/172350
if i recall/remembher correctly :D
thanks at least its not 'if I really cared' :D
heh, never thought of that
what makes it weird is that it doesn't even have to be a real mp3 file, it can just have a .mp3 extension :P
I only have to move my cursor across it and it happens. Btw when I run nautilus from a shell, it just returns to the shell immediatly with no messages.
yeah i know, i hate that :P
can I ask you an unrelated question about networking lol?
in my syslog it says 'Unable to find the Master Browser name STEVE<lb> for the workgroup STEVE.
your best asking the entire channel than just one channel member
in my syslog it says 'Unable to find the Domain* Master Browser name STEVE<lb> for the workgroup STEVE.
